Speaker: weiner
Dialogue: Whoa, whoa, whoa... what's that?

Speaker: ock
Dialogue: We begin again... let's kick in that new transducer. See if we can double the power output.

Speaker: weiner
Dialogue: Whoa, Doc... wait a minute...

Speaker: ock
Dialogue: Okey... dokey!

Speaker: liz
Dialogue: Hiya Peter...

Speaker: peter
Dialogue: Hiya Liz... how're you doing...?

Speaker: liz
Dialogue: How'm I doing what?

Speaker: harry
Dialogue: Peter! Peter! Wait up!

Speaker: harry
Dialogue: Would you, uh... excuse us for a minute?

Speaker: peter
Dialogue: What is it? what...

Speaker: harry
Dialogue: Did the Astro-Physics Journal really accept your paper?

Speaker: peter
Dialogue: Yeah... well... all I got's the data but they've agreed to publish it when it's finished. You know... it's my calculation on the Planetary Conjunction.

Speaker: harry
Dialogue: And its influence on the anti-force. Isn't it?

Speaker: peter
Dialogue: Yes. Look, Harry, I am busy with...

Speaker: harry
Dialogue: Yeah, you and the rest of the class. Every one is busy with Liz.

Speaker: liz
Dialogue: Peter?

Speaker: flash
Dialogue: Hiya, cupcakes...

Speaker: liz
Dialogue: Flash...!

Speaker: harry
Dialogue: And Flash is the busiest of them all...

Speaker: peter
Dialogue: Come on, Harry... we'll be late for Octavius.

Speaker: harry
Dialogue: Ock is nuts, don't you agree?

Speaker: peter
Dialogue: Ock is a genius, Harry. Crazy, Yes! But, a genius misunderstood, and unappreciated.

Speaker: roz
Dialogue: Doctor Octavius! You are late for your lecture. The students are waiting. Doctor Octavius!

Speaker: thorkel
Dialogue: Your friend is impossible Professor Rosomorf, I told the board we should let him go.

Speaker: thorkel
Dialogue: What's he doing in there, not his crazy experiment again.

Speaker: roz
Dialogue: You mean his anti-force theory... one day they'll give him the Nobel Prize for it.

Speaker: thorkel
Dialogue: Meanwhile he is demolishing our university. Octavius!!  Open the door.

Speaker: ock
Dialogue: The anti-force experiment has now reached the limit of electronic overload safety. Therefore, Weiner, you will disconnect the overload safety device...

Speaker: weiner
Dialogue: Whoa, Doc... someone's at the door...

Speaker: ock
Dialogue: World class scientific mind and they stick me in the basement with this third rate cyclotron...

Speaker: ock
Dialogue: Okey! Dokey!

Speaker: liz
Dialogue: What is it, Peter?

Speaker: peter
Dialogue: It's nothing.

Speaker: weiner
Dialogue: Yes, gentleman can I help you?

Speaker: thorkel
Dialogue: Tell your boss, that his class is waiting.

Speaker: weiner
Dialogue: You better tell him yourself.

Speaker: ock
Dialogue: Gentlemen, come, you must see this.

Speaker: roz
Dialogue: But, your students...

Speaker: ock
Dialogue: The imbeciles can wait... I have better things to do than teach introductory Physics Rosomorf. Undergrads are kindless adolescence.

Speaker: thorkel
Dialogue: You see he is impossible.

Speaker: ock
Dialogue: Thorkel you are the dummiest administrator our university has ever had.  Don't go Thorkel!! Come! Look!

Speaker: thorkel
Dialogue: The university pays you to teach something to your students.

Speaker: liz
Dialogue: Well, do you mean nothing... or do you mean something but you won't tell me what it is?

Speaker: peter
Dialogue: I mean plain nothing.

Speaker: liz
Dialogue: Well, I guess that's about as nothing as you can get... plain nothing. A beat.

Speaker: peter
Dialogue: Liz...!

Speaker: liz
Dialogue: Ahh, it is something.

Speaker: peter
Dialogue: No... look.

Speaker: ock
Dialogue: I am going for 20 percent power!

Speaker: thorkel
Dialogue: NO!! Don't do that...

Speaker: roz
Dialogue: Ock! Its dangerous...

Speaker: thorkel
Dialogue: Ock I warn you...

Speaker: thorkel
Dialogue: Keep calm, everybody keep calm. Use the front door. Everybody out the front.

Speaker: peter
Dialogue: Liz! Come on...!

Speaker: liz
Dialogue: I can't. Help me!

Speaker: peter
Dialogue: I'm coming!

Speaker: liz
Dialogue: Peter!

Speaker: thorkel
Dialogue: Get back, you idiots. You can't go in there!

Speaker: liz
Dialogue: Help! Help me!

Speaker: peter
Dialogue: Thanks for your help Flash.

Speaker: flash
Dialogue: No problem wimp.

Speaker: peter
Dialogue: Our hero has a real way with words.

Speaker: liz
Dialogue: Oh, why don't you grow up.

Speaker: thorkel
Dialogue: This man will bring a disaster upon this university.

Speaker: ock
Dialogue: The universe is made up of forces... and counter-forces. Science is the study of the forces!

Speaker: ock
Dialogue: But I... Professor Otto Octavius... have devoted my life to the study of the counter-forces! Good job, Peter.

Speaker: peter
Dialogue: Thanks, Professor.

Speaker: thorkel
Dialogue: I don't believe it, I simply don't...

Speaker: ock
Dialogue: Can we carry on Mr. Thorkel.

Speaker: thorkel
Dialogue: I don't believe... oh, all right carry on Professor.

Speaker: ock
Dialogue: Well! This week my dear students I have made a stunning breakthrough...

Speaker: thorkel
Dialogue: Wait a minute, wait a minute... you've got fire forms to fill out, Dr. Octavius.

Speaker: ock
Dialogue: I have no time for forms, or administrators who persist in interrupting me, Mr. Thorkel.

Speaker: ock
Dialogue: I now believe its possible that these counter forces can be... collected... the way the magnifying glass collects the sunlight... and focused into a hard beam I call... Weiner!

Speaker: ock
Dialogue: I call it, the Anti-Force!

Speaker: ock
Dialogue: Gravity!

Speaker: liz
Dialogue: I'm sorry...

Speaker: peter
Dialogue: It's alright.

Speaker: ock
Dialogue: We patch in the cyclotron... The lights flicker and go dim.

Speaker: ock
Dialogue: Pay no attention to the lights... I of course steal its energy, and it looses power. We patch in the cyclotron... and we gradually apply power. The power that I am stealing...

Speaker: ock
Dialogue: And so we stand, four square against the fundamental force that orders and maintains our universe... gravity... which is holding down this goddamn ball. Rise!

Speaker: harry
Dialogue: What a crock...

Speaker: peter
Dialogue: Shut up Harry... this is very interesting.

Speaker: ock
Dialogue: Mr. Parker! Have you some... interesting observation you'd like to share with the class?

Speaker: peter
Dialogue: No sir...

Speaker: ock
Dialogue: Then shut up! And pay some attention to the experiment.

Speaker: ock
Dialogue: Rise! Rise!!!

Speaker: ock
Dialogue: Now that's what I call an experiment!

Speaker: ock
Dialogue: You are looking at a representation of two universes. Our Blue one. Our real universe... something we can touch and feel and see and draw calculations about. This is us. The Yellow universe... this is something else. Some other dimension... something... on the other side!

Speaker: ock
Dialogue: If it were possible to generate enough power behind it, the anti-force could wipe out not just gravity... but all our universal forces at the same time. In effect... it would blast a hole between this universe and the next. Each...  would flow into each other. No blue universe. No yellow. End, finished, over.

Speaker: liz
Dialogue: That sounds like a scenario for the end of the world.

Speaker: ock
Dialogue: My girl, it is! It is. It would mean wiping out everything that's known... and letting in everything that's unknown.

Speaker: flash
Dialogue: Isn't that a little dangerous?

Speaker: ock
Dialogue: Don't worry yourself, true inter- dimensional penetration is still purely theoretical, but one day... Maybe very near... maybe in the 21st century...

Speaker: liz
Dialogue: Look, it's just... I don't know... when you and Flash go after each other like that...

Speaker: peter
Dialogue: He's not my type.

Speaker: liz
Dialogue: He doesn't have to be.

Speaker: peter
Dialogue: Check.

Speaker: liz
Dialogue: And besides, he's not all bad.

Speaker: peter
Dialogue: You don't get nicknamed Flash because you're a rocket scientist, Liz.

Speaker: liz
Dialogue: Give it up, Parker. You'd die for a nickname like Flash.

Speaker: peter
Dialogue: Yeah, of embarrassment.

Speaker: kim
Dialogue: Hey, Flash... I'm scalping a pair of the Midnight Madness Wrestling Match tomorrow night.

Speaker: flash
Dialogue: The Slammies??? I'd kill for that!!!

Speaker: kim
Dialogue: Would you pay $125?

Speaker: flash
Dialogue: Well, uh, I... gee... if... can I tell you tomorrow?

Speaker: kim
Dialogue: You snooze, you lose. Hiya Liz...

Speaker: liz
Dialogue: Kim, you know Peter and Harry? This is my new roommate... Kim Nickson.

Speaker: kim
Dialogue: Hellooo, Peter.

Speaker: peter
Dialogue: Hi...

Speaker: liz
Dialogue: We're going to the Student Reunion Meeting. You coming?

Speaker: peter
Dialogue: I can't... I gotta go over to the Daily Bugle. I'm trying to sell some photos.

Speaker: kim
Dialogue: Soooh, a photographer...?

Speaker: peter
Dialogue: Just an amateur. Well... nice meeting you, Kim.

Speaker: kim
Dialogue: Yeah... I bet it would be.

Speaker: harry
Dialogue: Can I be your date for the reunion ShooShoo?

Speaker: kim
Dialogue: No Jerk!

Speaker: harry
Dialogue: What did I say...

Speaker: liz
Dialogue: It's not what you said, it's how you say it, ShooShoo!

Speaker: harry
Dialogue: Damn!

Speaker: weiner
Dialogue: Peter, Doc Ock wants to see you.

Speaker: peter
Dialogue: About my data I bet.

Speaker: weiner
Dialogue: I don't know.

Speaker: peter
Dialogue: He knows about my work on the Planetary Conjunction, doesn't he?

Speaker: weiner
Dialogue: I don't know.

Speaker: peter
Dialogue: Hello, Professor Octavius.  I really admired your experiment.

Speaker: ock
Dialogue: We have a lot of interests in common, Peter. Perhaps we should put our heads together, if you know what I mean...

Speaker: peter
Dialogue: That would be... great.

Speaker: ock
Dialogue: Now you take the Planetary Conjunction. This Saturday night we will witness Saturn, Jupiter, the Moon, the Earth, the Sun... all in a row. Never seen within the memory of man, or measured for its effect. The total gravitational force must be quite exceptional. Isn't that the subject of your paper...?

Speaker: peter
Dialogue: Yes sir, I've worked out a new way to calculate the combined gravitational effect.

Speaker: ock
Dialogue: I'm a busy man, Mr. Parker. But I think I could find the time to go over it with you. Make sure it all... checks out.

Speaker: peter
Dialogue: Well... I'm sort of working with Professor Rosomorf and he suggested we kind of keep it between us. He thinks that my theory is... well, I don't know...

Speaker: ock
Dialogue: I want to see that data, Peter!

Speaker: peter
Dialogue: But Professor Octavius... if I knew you were interested... sorry, I've already given it to... Professor Rosomorf, and he is after all the head of our Physics Department... and I couldn't...

Speaker: ock
Dialogue: Well, I'm certain something can be worked out. Run along, young man.

Speaker: ock
Dialogue: Just a minute... how about if I show you my discoveries... something I never showed to any other student... as a matter of fact to anybody at all.

Speaker: peter
Dialogue: Well I am really flattered, I mean I'd love to... but I...

Speaker: ock
Dialogue: Very well shall we say if you come here tonight...

Speaker: peter
Dialogue: But Professor I don't now if I should...

Speaker: ock
Dialogue: Make it eight sharp... I'll be waiting for you... Right here...

Speaker: ock
Dialogue: The same academic world that's so keen to embrace that boy's undergraduate work, ridicules my anti-force theory as quackery. I ask you, Weiner... what is our society coming to? Ha!

Speaker: weiner
Dialogue: They are all a bunch of brainless assholes, that's what I say...

Speaker: ock
Dialogue: Weiner! Go get me that boy's data!

Speaker: weiner
Dialogue: Cost you fifty bucks.

Speaker: ock
Dialogue: Just get it. We'll negotiate your fee when you have the data, alright Weiner?

Speaker: jameson
Dialogue: Bag ladies. I hate bag ladies.

Speaker: peter
Dialogue: Yes, sir.

Speaker: jameson
Dialogue: Little kids... I hate little kids. This is a daily newspaper. We need news value photographs, not artsy-fartsy shit!

Speaker: peter
Dialogue: Yes, sir.

Speaker: jameson
Dialogue: Kid? You want a pro's assessment?

Speaker: peter
Dialogue: Yes, sir!

Speaker: jameson
Dialogue: Parker, my readers are morons. I gotta grab them by the eyes. Every time you press the button of that Nikon of yours it costs you fifty-five cents. So the next time you're about to take the plunge, ask yourself, am I taking dog bites man? Because if you are...

Speaker: peter
Dialogue: I know, I know. You want man bites dog...

Speaker: jameson
Dialogue: Parker, this is the post modern 20th century. I want man eats dog! Get out!

Speaker: peter
Dialogue: Rent! Rent, more bills, rent... electricity, bills...

Speaker: peter
Dialogue: There's nothing in there worth stealing!

Speaker: peter
Dialogue: Aunt May, you're trespassing.

Speaker: may
Dialogue: I was just so desperately bored... I thought I'd come over and make you dinner...

Speaker: peter
Dialogue: I am old enough to... to make my own--

Speaker: may
Dialogue: But I didn't feel like getting to know your roaches.

Speaker: peter
Dialogue: I'll introduce you.

Speaker: may
Dialogue: Oh. And those foul chemicals in the pots...

Speaker: peter
Dialogue: I take pictures, remember?

Speaker: may
Dialogue: Anyway, I've decided to kidnap you for dinner in Forest Hills...

Speaker: peter
Dialogue: It's Friday night...

Speaker: may
Dialogue: Yes. Do you have a date?

Speaker: peter
Dialogue: No.

Speaker: may
Dialogue: Then come on.

Speaker: thorkel
Dialogue: Professor Rosomorf, what happened here?

Speaker: roz
Dialogue: Someone tried to rob me of some paper... I suspect they were looking for that one.

Speaker: thorkel
Dialogue: What is it?

Speaker: roz
Dialogue: Peter Parker's data on the Planetary Conjunction. Damn lucky I hid it in my computer under another title.

Speaker: thorkel
Dialogue: My God, what's going on in our school? First Professor Octavius almost blows up the Physics lab... Now this. You report it in triplicate, of course.

Speaker: roz
Dialogue: Thorkel, be careful when you talk to Octavius. Remember... the man is a very fragile genius. One day he'll bring us all the Noble Prize.

Speaker: thorkel
Dialogue: Rosomorf, the man is a very dangerous crackpot!

Speaker: roz
Dialogue: That's him again. He's working day and night.

Speaker: thorkel
Dialogue: I tell you the man is very dangerous.  Come on Rosomorf, let's stop him before this building will explode.

Speaker: thorkel
Dialogue: Shut it down, Octavius.

Speaker: thorkel
Dialogue: You've blown half the circuits in the Science Center.

Speaker: ock
Dialogue: Call an electrician.

Speaker: thorkel
Dialogue: I have called the locksmith.

Speaker: ock
Dialogue: What... what is he doing.

Speaker: thorkel
Dialogue: We have to shut your lab down and take a look at the lines.

Speaker: roz
Dialogue: Please, Otto, we must lock it up.

Speaker: ock
Dialogue: You're denying me access to my cyclotron?!

Speaker: thorkel
Dialogue: You bet.

Speaker: ock
Dialogue: Okey, dokey... just give me till tomorrow. I want to clean up my papers. Tomorrow... Ha... Tomorrow you can have this room...

Speaker: roz
Dialogue: Oh... well Thorkel... few more hours won't make a difference.

Speaker: thorkel
Dialogue: I hope.

Speaker: ben
Dialogue: Another brewski?

Speaker: peter
Dialogue: No, I'm fine, Uncle Ben.

Speaker: ben
Dialogue: You don't follow the Mets like you used to, do you, Pete?

Speaker: peter
Dialogue: No, not so much anymore.

Speaker: ben
Dialogue: Funny. When your Mom and Dad, uh, passed away... I had this idea... I wanted you to be the best baseball player that ever was. Geez, what ever happened to that?

Speaker: peter
Dialogue: Little league.

Speaker: ben
Dialogue: Yeah... Babe Ruth you wasn't.

Speaker: aunt may
Dialogue: It's on the table! Turn off the TV!

Speaker: aunt may
Dialogue: How's that girl you told us about, Peter?

Speaker: peter
Dialogue: Liz? She's great... But she has a boyfriend.

Speaker: aunt may
Dialogue: A boy your age should have a girlfriend.

Speaker: peter
Dialogue: Aunt May... she has a steady boyfriend.

Speaker: aunt may
Dialogue: Peter, any girl that's worth your attention is of course gonna have a boyfriend... But if she really gets to know what you have to offer she'll... you get my drift?

Speaker: ben
Dialogue: Look, just leave him alone, okay. When he's ready for girls he'll be a holy terror.  Lookit, how are you fixed for money, Pete? Maybe I can help you out a little.

Speaker: peter
Dialogue: No, I'm alright. My scholarship covers almost everything, and I sell some photos here and there. Today my physics professor asked for some of my work... he wants to study my data. They might publish my work in the science magazine... that'll bring me some money...

Speaker: ben
Dialogue: Publish your work?! You hear that May...?

Speaker: peter
Dialogue: Yeah, in fact I have to leave a little early tonight, to meet Professor Octavius... He offered me to be his assistant...

Speaker: ben
Dialogue: Whoa! Did you hear that May...?

Speaker: aunt may
Dialogue: Oh, Peter, you promised you'd spend the night...

Speaker: peter
Dialogue: I... I can't, Aunt May. Professor Octavius wants to discuss my new findings.

Speaker: aunt may
Dialogue: Peter, what you should be finding... is a nice girlfriend.

Speaker: ock
Dialogue: I'll show them... closing the cyclotron on me... Weiner!

Speaker: weiner
Dialogue: Yes, Professor...

Speaker: ock
Dialogue: Where is he? It's ten past eight o'clock...

Speaker: weiner
Dialogue: That must be him. He opens the door.

Speaker: peter
Dialogue: Good evening.

Speaker: ock
Dialogue: You are late.  Weiner, go outside and get us something to eat. And don't steal it! Just buy it. I'll reimburse you.

Speaker: weiner
Dialogue: Do you want anything Parker?

Speaker: peter
Dialogue: No thank you, I just had dinner at my aunt's...

Speaker: ock
Dialogue: Piss off, Weiner!

Speaker: ock
Dialogue: Okey, dokey, Parker... how would you like to take Weiner's place... I mean, be my assistant?

Speaker: peter
Dialogue: Well, Professor, that would be a great honor, but I'm already working with...

Speaker: ock
Dialogue: Rosomorf... that imbecile. Don't you understand, kid, that I am about to uncover the greatest discovery since Einstein came up with his theory of relativity... The "Anti-Force."

Speaker: peter
Dialogue: Wow! The theory of the Anti-force! You should go for the Noble Prize Professor...

Speaker: ock
Dialogue: Noble Shmoble, I am going for a much bigger prize kid. Okey, dokey. Let me show you, kid, what I got here.

Speaker: ock
Dialogue: Present maximum anti-force power to date is 38 percent of theoretical limit. I have patched in the variable particle-wave accelerator...  And if your paper has any value... I can use it to get the power I'm missing to create the anti-force, to break through and beat any other form of power in our or any other universe, capish!

Speaker: peter
Dialogue: Sorry, Professor, I can't do it. I gave my word to Professor Rosomorf.

Speaker: ock
Dialogue: 50 percent... anti-force... 50 percent... that's all I'm missing! Parker, we can be rich together!

Speaker: peter
Dialogue: Sorry... I'd better go now.

Speaker: ock
Dialogue: You'll be sorry, Parker.

Speaker: ock
Dialogue: You! Get out of there, you creeping...

Speaker: ock
Dialogue: Noooooooooooo!

Speaker: ock
Dialogue: It's an energy storm! Okey! Dokey!

Speaker: weiner
Dialogue: Professor... what happened to you? What did you do...

Speaker: weiner
Dialogue: Oh my God... what happened here...

Speaker: weiner
Dialogue: I better get out of here.

Speaker: thorkel
Dialogue: There is no danger. Please go back to your dorms. I repeat, there is no danger.

Speaker: jameson
Dialogue: Spill it out, Professor! The public wants to know!

Speaker: thorkel
Dialogue: Who are you?

Speaker: jameson
Dialogue: Jameson, Daily Bugle, Chief Editor, now what really happened here?

Speaker: thorkel
Dialogue: There will be a press announcement in the morning Mr. Jameson... now if you'll excuse me.

Speaker: thorkel
Dialogue: I have nothing to say... there will be an announcement. Now, please go home... everybody... we must clear the grounds...

Speaker: flash
Dialogue: You think they'll cancel classes?

Speaker: harry
Dialogue: They must... the whole building must be contaminated with some kind of poisonous gas.

Speaker: peter
Dialogue: How about nuclear contaminations?

Speaker: kim
Dialogue: My God... lets beat it. But nobody moves.

Speaker: liz
Dialogue: Could anyone be in there, Peter?

Speaker: peter
Dialogue: I don't know... Maybe Professor Octavius. He usually works late...

Speaker: flash
Dialogue: That nut, I bet it was all his doing...

Speaker: jameson
Dialogue: Hey Parker! Peter Parker!

Speaker: peter
Dialogue: Mr. Jameson! What are you doing here? What's going on?

Speaker: jameson
Dialogue: That's for them to know, and for you to find out.

Speaker: peter
Dialogue: But sir, they wouldn't tell us. You heard Thorkel... he said...

Speaker: jameson
Dialogue: A press announcement tomorrow...! But we must know tonight Parker. This is your university, right...

Speaker: peter
Dialogue: Yes, but...

Speaker: jameson
Dialogue: You got your camera?

Speaker: peter
Dialogue: Sure, but I can't--

Speaker: jameson
Dialogue: A hundred dollars says you can?

Speaker: peter
Dialogue: Yes sir!

Speaker: jameson
Dialogue: Get inside and get pictures, fifty bucks.

Speaker: peter
Dialogue: You just said a hundred.

Speaker: jameson
Dialogue: Seventy, but I want blood and gore.

Speaker: peter
Dialogue: Seeya guys.

Speaker: liz
Dialogue: Where is he going?

Speaker: jameson
Dialogue: To make fifty bucks.

Speaker: thorkel
Dialogue: What was that?

Speaker: roz
Dialogue: What was what?

Speaker: thorkel
Dialogue: What hit me?

Speaker: roz
Dialogue: What hit you?

Speaker: thorkel
Dialogue: I don't know. It was so fast.

Speaker: roz
Dialogue: You're going to be fine, Otto.

Speaker: peter
Dialogue: Ow!!!

Speaker: peter
Dialogue: I feel a little funny...

Speaker: guard
Dialogue: Yeah? Well, I ain't laughing. Get out... Just get out of here...

Speaker: guard
Dialogue: You get yourself over to the Police lines.

Speaker: peter
Dialogue: Right. Police lines.

Speaker: jameson
Dialogue: Okay, scoop, whaddaya got?

Speaker: peter
Dialogue: I... got pictures of the Professor... in there... it's so strange in there... so bizarre...

Speaker: jameson
Dialogue: There'll be two crisp twenties tucked inside.

Speaker: peter
Dialogue: This is weird. My God, I feel so weird...

Speaker: peter
Dialogue: Very weird.

Speaker: peter
Dialogue: Very, very weird.

Speaker: peter
Dialogue: Well, what the hell!!

Speaker: reiss
Dialogue: You're a kid who's going places, and I'm gonna point you the right way.

Speaker: peter
Dialogue: Max Reiss, models, strip dancers, escort girls, blue movies...

Speaker: reiss
Dialogue: Oops... sorry, wrong card.

Speaker: peter
Dialogue: Max Reiss, Talent management.

Speaker: reiss
Dialogue: It's a big outfit. Got a lot of departments.

Speaker: peter
Dialogue: Yeah... well... why you approach me? I'm not...

Speaker: reiss
Dialogue: Oh yes you are... very talented. The three questions of show business success. One do you think you possess a unique talent?

Speaker: peter
Dialogue: Well...

Speaker: reiss
Dialogue: Two... what are you gonna do with it?

Speaker: peter
Dialogue: Well... I don't know.

Speaker: reiss
Dialogue: Three... how much money you got in your pocket?

Speaker: peter
Dialogue: Ten.

Speaker: reiss
Dialogue: You invest half of that with me and I'll make you a star.

Speaker: peter
Dialogue: What are you talking about?

Speaker: reiss
Dialogue: I'm talking about fame. I'm talking about fortune. I'm talking about the chance of a lifetime. How'd you like to be on MTV tomorrow night?

Speaker: peter
Dialogue: MTV...? Me? Really?

Speaker: reiss
Dialogue: Taxi!

Speaker: peter
Dialogue: Hey!

Speaker: reiss
Dialogue: Kid! Tomorrow night. Same place, same time.

Speaker: peter
Dialogue: How do you know I'll show up?

Speaker: reiss
Dialogue: Because you wanna be a star... everybody does.

Speaker: peter
Dialogue: Hello? Aunt May?

Speaker: peter
Dialogue: Well, no, I mean yeah I'm fine, but listen... Aunti, the craziest thing happened to me tonight.

Speaker: aunt may
Dialogue: Does this have to do with a certain girl we talked about at dinner?

Speaker: peter
Dialogue: No, no, look, there was this radioactive experiment... I was poisoned!

Speaker: aunt may
Dialogue: You were what?

Speaker: peter
Dialogue: I was bitten by a bug.

Speaker: aunt may
Dialogue: Oh! I get it, you mean a love bug.

Speaker: peter
Dialogue: No... No... A spider...

Speaker: aunt may
Dialogue: Peter, did you at least talk to her?

Speaker: peter
Dialogue: Aunt May, listen to me. I got bitten on the hand... by a poisonous spider.

Speaker: aunt may
Dialogue: She bit you?

Speaker: peter
Dialogue: No. I was in the bathroom and...

Speaker: aunt may
Dialogue: Oh, you did it in the bathroom? Peter, this is craziness, why don't you use your bed? You're up all night. You're in the radioactive labs. You never take time to eat or sleep. Am I right?

Speaker: peter
Dialogue: Yes, Aunt May.

Speaker: peter
Dialogue: Yes, Aunt May.

Speaker: peter
Dialogue: And I love you too, Aunt May.  And by the way, I got a mess of super powers today.

Speaker: chief surgeon
Dialogue: Look at these brainwave readings. The mental activity is ten times of any normal man...!

Speaker: brainman
Dialogue: Equipment malfunction...?

Speaker: chief surgeon
Dialogue: My God... I thought I'd seen everything...

Speaker: nurse
Dialogue: It is so freaky...

Speaker: chief surgeon
Dialogue: Hang in there, man.

Speaker: chief surgeon
Dialogue: Nurse! Number seven scalpel. Arthroscope stand by. Read out parameters in progress. Let's go in. You alright?

Speaker: nurse
Dialogue: Yes... Yes, of course. Everything's online.

Speaker: chief surgeon
Dialogue: Scalpel! No... no... a larger one... the largest we have!

Speaker: head nurse
Dialogue: Kill the alarms!

Speaker: brainman
Dialogue: He's going off the chart!

Speaker: chief surgeon
Dialogue: Mop. Mop! Sutures and clamps! Hurry up!

Speaker: chief surgeon
Dialogue: Zap him!

Speaker: brainman
Dialogue: Stabilizing alpha waves...

Speaker: nurse
Dialogue: You have a visitor, Doctor...

Speaker: thorkel
Dialogue: Octavius, I'm afraid I have bad news for you.

Speaker: ock
Dialogue: The cyclotron is damaged...

Speaker: thorkel
Dialogue: What used to be the cyclotron was permanently shut down this afternoon.

Speaker: ock
Dialogue: But my work!

Speaker: thorkel
Dialogue: Your work is a disaster! Look at yourself!

Speaker: ock
Dialogue: Myself? I don't matter. Nobody matters anymore. To enter a new dimension we must first destroy our own...

Speaker: thorkel
Dialogue: What are you saying?

Speaker: ock
Dialogue: Destroy life. Life is... insignificant. Bags of sleepy, sluggish flesh. What would you say?

Speaker: thorkel
Dialogue: Oh, my God, what are those horrible things sticking from your body?

Speaker: ock
Dialogue: Thorkel, if I told you that for one moment in time I broke all the laws! For one brief glorious moment, I broke through to the other side. I saw... I felt... I became creation.

Speaker: thorkel
Dialogue: What on Earth are you rambling about?

Speaker: ock
Dialogue: Destiny!!! My destiny! I see it all so clearly now. Universal destruction, yes. All I need is the power... then I can destroy this illusion you call life. It is my destiny to lead us to the light!

Speaker: thorkel
Dialogue: You're a madman.

Speaker: ock
Dialogue: And you are a fool. I will end the universe as you know it. And in that final moment... I'll laugh my ass off while you're kissing yours goodbye!

Speaker: thorkel
Dialogue: Goodbye is right, Octavius... You're fired... sacked... canned. You are history, Doctor Octavius. And I couldn't be more pleased to be the first to tell you this good news...

Speaker: thorkel
Dialogue: Let me down Ock... you crazy... MONSTER! Let me down!

Speaker: ock
Dialogue: Okey, dokey.

Speaker: peter
Dialogue: MTV Wrestling?!

Speaker: reiss
Dialogue: That's the place. Pay the man.

Speaker: peter
Dialogue: Look, Mr. Reiss... I'm not real interested in watching a wrestling match.

Speaker: reiss
Dialogue: Who said anything about watching a wrestling match? You're here to win a wrestling match!

Speaker: peter
Dialogue: Me? You must be kidding.

Speaker: reiss
Dialogue: You hop around. You know, the way you did last night. Your opponent gets tired. He falls down. The ref counts to three, you win, and we pick up a thousand bucks.

Speaker: reiss
Dialogue: You're really gonna love this.

Speaker: peter
Dialogue: Look, really, I don't know...

Speaker: reiss
Dialogue: You don't have to know. I know enough for both of us.  Change in there.

Speaker: peter
Dialogue: What is this?

Speaker: reiss
Dialogue: A costume... something that fits your talent. Go put it on. I'm sure you'll like it.

Speaker: peter
Dialogue: How does it look? I feel like it's Halloween.

Speaker: reiss
Dialogue: Cover your face with the mask.

Speaker: peter
Dialogue: Why?

Speaker: reiss
Dialogue: Mystery, my friend. Nobody should know who you are...

Speaker: ring announcer
Dialogue: And now, a new challenger, for the thousand dollar fight, weighing in at one hundred and fifty pounds... from parts unknown! Here is the Amazing... Mysterious... Incredible Superman...

Speaker: reiss
Dialogue: No, not Superman... Spider-Man... SPIDER-MAN!!!

Speaker: ring announcer
Dialogue: ...Spider-Man!!!!!

Speaker: old lady
Dialogue: Kill the sucker, Crusher!

Speaker: hipster
Dialogue: Whatsamatter, Crusher, can't you crush that bug?

Speaker: crusher
Dialogue: Okay, Web Face, this is it!

Speaker: hipster
Dialogue: Hey, Crusher, you need a insecticide!

Speaker: flash
Dialogue: Will you look at this Spider-Man guy! He is absolutely incredible!

Speaker: kim
Dialogue: Liz, get a load of this outfit! I wish I had it for the Halloween party... it's quite sexy.

Speaker: liz
Dialogue: Will you two shush. I'm trying to work.

Speaker: ref
Dialogue: One...!

Speaker: reiss
Dialogue: Get up...! Get up...!

Speaker: ref
Dialogue: Two...!

Speaker: ref
Dialogue: Ladies and Gentlemen, history is made today, we have here the first man to win a thousand dollars against the mighty Crusher.

Speaker: peter
Dialogue: Max! Am I really gonna get a thousand...

Speaker: reiss
Dialogue: We are going to get a thousand--

Speaker: crusher
Dialogue: Hi, who are you, kid?

Speaker: peter
Dialogue: I'm Peter Parker.

Speaker: reiss
Dialogue: He is Spider-Man, and I handle him... Whenever you want a rematch call me. Next time it's gonna be ten thousand, what do you say... Crusher?

Speaker: crusher
Dialogue: Oh, well, I don't know what happened to me tonight...  I really don't know...

Speaker: reiss
Dialogue: I know... you lost. Big man you lost to the Amazing Spider-Man.

Speaker: peter
Dialogue: You know who that is?

Speaker: liz
Dialogue: Yeah... he's some clown we saw on TV last night... boy does Flash think he's hot.

Speaker: peter
Dialogue: He does...

Speaker: kim
Dialogue: I love wrestling.

Speaker: harry
Dialogue: Wrestling is all bluff. Do you really believe this little guy in a stupid Spider-Man suit beat the Crusher?

Speaker: liz
Dialogue: Hey, we better rush... visiting hours will be over soon.

Speaker: nurse
Dialogue: Doctor Octavius? You have visitors. Doctor Octavius?

Speaker: peter
Dialogue: Ock is not here!

Speaker: liz
Dialogue: My God, what happened?

Speaker: nurse
Dialogue: I'd better call the doctor!

Speaker: harry
Dialogue: You'd better call the police!

Speaker: ock
Dialogue: What a wreck. What a useless, wasted wreck. Okey, dokey. We rebuild you, my damaged darling. Bigger, better, hotter! A world class, super cyclotron!

Speaker: weiner
Dialogue: There you are, doc... where have you been... whoa this place is messed up.

Speaker: weiner
Dialogue: Whoa, doc! You look a little messed up yourself.

Speaker: ock
Dialogue: Where have you been, you imbecile?

Speaker: weiner
Dialogue: I went to the wrestling...

Speaker: ock
Dialogue: Wrestling...

Speaker: weiner
Dialogue: I went after the kid. You still want that Parker guy's data, don't you?

Speaker: ock
Dialogue: Well, did you get it?

Speaker: weiner
Dialogue: No, I followed him... but I lost him in the crowd.

Speaker: ock
Dialogue: Lost him? You--

Speaker: weiner
Dialogue: I'll find him, Maestro... I promise... soon... maybe by tomorrow.

Speaker: ock
Dialogue: So how was the wrestling?

Speaker: weiner
Dialogue: Fantastic! There was this new wrestler... beat the mighty Crusher. You won't believe it... a nothing of a guy... calls himself this stupid name... the Amazing Spider-Man... would you believe it?

Speaker: ock
Dialogue: Spider-Man, huh? Well, maybe I'll just go and wrestle myself one of these days... with all my new arms... I'm sure I can beat Crusher or any other monster.

Speaker: ock
Dialogue: Will I beat him, this Crusher, will I beat him or not?

Speaker: weiner
Dialogue: No... no, please... I mean yes, yes... you'll beat him easily... let me down... Please... I'll do anything for you...

Speaker: ock
Dialogue: The Parker data... get me the Parker data, you hear?!!!

Speaker: weiner
Dialogue: I'm looking for Peter Parker.

Speaker: weiner
Dialogue: Hey, I know you...

Speaker: weiner
Dialogue: I saw you crushing the Crusher.

Speaker: weiner
Dialogue: I love it! You are the best wrestler I have ever seen... please don't hurt me!

Speaker: weiner
Dialogue: Oh, please... don't kill me. Please help me down.

Speaker: weiner
Dialogue: Yes... yes, you are.

Speaker: clerk
Dialogue: Holy cow, whattaya building, fella, a cyclotron?

Speaker: ock
Dialogue: Wrap it up...

Speaker: clerk
Dialogue: What about the money... or do you pay by credit card?

Speaker: ock
Dialogue: Cash! I'll be back soon.

Speaker: bank guard
Dialogue: What's going on here?

Speaker: ock
Dialogue: Cash!

Speaker: peter
Dialogue: Doesn't he look amazing in that one? Look, he's flying in the air!

Speaker: jameson
Dialogue: I don't care if he flies to the moon. He's just another wrestler in a silly costume. Look at this, Parker, right off the wire. This is the guy who hit that armored truck this morning. They say he has metal arms... get me a picture of this character!

Speaker: peter
Dialogue: Metal arms?

Speaker: jameson
Dialogue: Four of them.

Speaker: jameson
Dialogue: The web faced weirdo... He is a joke in a Halloween costume... don't make me laugh.

Speaker: jameson
Dialogue: Now get out of here and don't come back without something I can use!

Speaker: peter
Dialogue: Yes sir...

Speaker: jameson
Dialogue: A mega baloney... A bug in blue tights... what next?

Speaker: peter
Dialogue: The Journal said he was a mega-smash on MTV...

Speaker: ock
Dialogue: What do you think you're doing?

Speaker: weiner
Dialogue: I'm going to the Masquerade. It's Halloween tonight Doc, aren't you coming to the School Ball? Whoa, you could go without an outfit.

Speaker: ock
Dialogue: You're not going to any ball, clown. You're going to get me Peter Parker's data...

Speaker: weiner
Dialogue: I was almost killed on my last try... Look at all these bruises...

Speaker: ock
Dialogue: I don't care if you come back dead. Just get it!

Speaker: weiner
Dialogue: Cost you a thousand bucks, if I get it.

Speaker: weiner
Dialogue: All right... boss please let go... P L E A S E ...

Speaker: ock
Dialogue: Just get it, Weiner. I'm running out of time. If you fail me again, you won't have to concern yourself with money anymore... DO YOU GET ME CLOWN?!

Speaker: harry
Dialogue: You should have worn a costume. I told you to wear a costume.

Speaker: peter
Dialogue: It's... embarrassing.

Speaker: harry
Dialogue: There's Liz...

Speaker: peter
Dialogue: Yeah...

Speaker: roz
Dialogue: ... howdy partners.

Speaker: harry
Dialogue: Any word on Doctor Octavius?

Speaker: roz
Dialogue: Nothing beyond what I read in the papers. I'm afraid he's not the same man we knew. You know, I've been digging through the notes on his experiments...

Speaker: roz
Dialogue: You boys must have had an extraordinary classroom experience.

Speaker: peter
Dialogue: Yes sir... oh... I'm going to be a little late with my paper on the Planetary Conjunction, sir...

Speaker: roz
Dialogue: Whenever you're ready... I'll look at it. I know it's going to be an important work... and Peter, take my hat.

Speaker: roz
Dialogue: It is a costume party.

Speaker: harry
Dialogue: Look, there's Spider-Man!

Speaker: peter
Dialogue: Not the real one, I'm sure...

Speaker: harry
Dialogue: You can never be sure... all kinds of crazy stuff can happen at a masquerade ball...

Speaker: peter
Dialogue: I bet I know who it is.

Speaker: peter
Dialogue: Hiya, Liz...

Speaker: liz
Dialogue: Hiya, Peter. Who is in the Spider-Man costume?

Speaker: peter
Dialogue: It's a very clever outfit you've got there, Flash.

Speaker: flash
Dialogue: Take a hike, asshole.

Speaker: liz
Dialogue: How did you recognize him?

Speaker: peter
Dialogue: His pretty blue eyes give him away...

Speaker: harry
Dialogue: Anyway, who'll be sitting with you at the Halloween Ball?

Speaker: liz
Dialogue: I wanna dance... Hey, Spider-Man... Shall we Flash dance?

Speaker: harry
Dialogue: Take her now, it's easy...

Speaker: harry
Dialogue: Wanna dance, Schechrezaa?

Speaker: kim
Dialogue: I'm pooped.

Speaker: liz
Dialogue: I'm not...

Speaker: flash
Dialogue: Holy jumping jelly beans, willya look at these pictures of Spider-Man? Wow! Is this guy great or what?

Speaker: liz
Dialogue: Hey, Peter! These are your pictures!

Speaker: flash
Dialogue: Can't be...

Speaker: liz
Dialogue: It says here "Photos by Peter Parker."

Speaker: flash
Dialogue: You know this guy, Parker?

Speaker: peter
Dialogue: Well, yeah... sort of...

Speaker: flash
Dialogue: Wow... I'll give you anything if you introduce us.

Speaker: harry
Dialogue: Will you grant me this dance...?

Speaker: kim
Dialogue: Hey, Flash-Man... Wanna dance...?

Speaker: flash
Dialogue: Well, why not.

Speaker: young woman
Dialogue: Thank you, thank you. We have a special surprise guest tonight.  The Empire State University Masquerade Ball presents... The "Slammy" winning star of MTV'S wrestling tournament... The Amazing Spider-Man!

Speaker: flash
Dialogue: Go ahead... go ahead!

Speaker: liz
Dialogue: Come on... Flash...

Speaker: liz
Dialogue: Who are you...?

Speaker: peter
Dialogue: One day you'll know...

Speaker: liz
Dialogue: You sound very familiar.

Speaker: ben
Dialogue: What a bunch of crap. Goddamn rock and roll's screwed up the whole TV.

Speaker: ben
Dialogue: Come on, May. Wake up and go to sleep.

Speaker: cabbie
Dialogue: What'm I in, a race?

Speaker: cabbie
Dialogue: Your family?

Speaker: cabbie
Dialogue: Step on it... so now you want to kill yourself in another accident... not with me, Boychick.

Speaker: cabbie
Dialogue: ... tingling... I know. And I got ulcers... Everybody's got something to worry about.

Speaker: cabbie
Dialogue: Okay, you asked for it.

Speaker: aunt may
Dialogue: What's that?

Speaker: ben
Dialogue: What? It's nothing... go back to sleep...  Oh, I'll go look. Go back to sleep.

Speaker: weiner
Dialogue: Hmmm...

Speaker: cabbie
Dialogue: Some crazy kinda town, huh? You hear about that hold-up? The guy with the six arms? Hey, I see it all on this job.  What kinda outfit is that, anyway?

Speaker: cabbie
Dialogue: You said the magic words, we have a flat Boychick.

Speaker: ben
Dialogue: Mice...

Speaker: cabbie
Dialogue: Hey! You wanna hand me that lug wrench?

Speaker: cabbie
Dialogue: Some crazy kinda town...

Speaker: weiner
Dialogue: All I want it the kid's computer crap!

Speaker: ben
Dialogue: Let go before I blow your brain's out.

Speaker: peter
Dialogue: Uncle Ben!

Speaker: ben
Dialogue: Peter...

Speaker: peter
Dialogue: Oh my God... Uncle Ben...

Speaker: aunt may
Dialogue: Ben gets through everything. He'll be alright. The doctors are...

Speaker: detective
Dialogue: Excuse me. You the nephew?

Speaker: detective
Dialogue: Your uncle's a brave man. Apparently, the perpetrator was after something of yours. Your uncle didn't know what it was but he stood up to him anyway. You ought to be proud of him.

Speaker: peter
Dialogue: I am... how is he...

Speaker: detective
Dialogue: Ask the Doctor.

Speaker: aunt may
Dialogue: How's my... how's my husband doing...?

Speaker: doctor
Dialogue: Mrs. Parker, I'm sorry. We tried.

Speaker: doctor
Dialogue: Crash cart! STAT!

Speaker: detective
Dialogue: Let the medics handle it.  Look, if it makes you feel any better. We're gonna nail this guy. He crashed his getaway car. We got him trapped in a warehouse on Jackson.

Speaker: nurse
Dialogue: She's alright. She just fainted. We'll have to check her for symptoms of shock. If you want to wait, you can get some coffee on the third floor.

Speaker: peter
Dialogue: No, I... I think I wanna go out for some fresh air.

Speaker: radio
Dialogue: That's a go.

Speaker: weiner
Dialogue: You ain't takin' me... Spider-Man... who ever you are...

Speaker: weiner
Dialogue: Whoa... stay back down there!

Speaker: weiner
Dialogue: Stand up, you.

Speaker: weiner
Dialogue: You're my ticket outa here. Gimme that stupid mask!

Speaker: weiner
Dialogue: Then I'll take it myself.

Speaker: weiner
Dialogue: Don't hurt me, man. Please don't hurt me...

Speaker: ock
Dialogue: Okey, dokey.

Speaker: ock
Dialogue: Amperage, okay. Flux, 14. Negative variable differential... good enough.

Speaker: ock
Dialogue: Okey, dokey... now all I need is Parker's data. Where the hell is Weiner? Damn it... I can't trust anybody.  I'll be back... my babies... my new babies!

Speaker: peter
Dialogue: Oh my God... oh, it's you, Liz... I didn't expect you... uh... give me a minute.

Speaker: peter
Dialogue: Hi, Liz. Come on in.

Speaker: liz
Dialogue: What were you doing in here?

Speaker: peter
Dialogue: Cleaning up. Come on. I'll get your computer. Where's Flash parked?

Speaker: liz
Dialogue: Flash didn't come.

Speaker: peter
Dialogue: Oh. Well... how are you going to get it home?

Speaker: liz
Dialogue: Taxi... I guess.

Speaker: liz
Dialogue: You must spend a lot of time with this Spider-Man guy... Peter! Don't you think you ought to unplug that!

Speaker: peter
Dialogue: I, uh, I'll go down to the corner... see it I can hail that taxi.

Speaker: liz
Dialogue: Peter...?

Speaker: liz
Dialogue: Doctor Octavius...! You're... You're...  You're so weird!... with those... what do you call those...

Speaker: ock
Dialogue: Waldos... Did you hear about Spider-Man?  That's me... the real Spider-Man... now tell me, where is that jerky friend of yours... Parker?

Speaker: liz
Dialogue: Peter?... oh... he's not here. He's gone. I don't think he'll be back for awhile.

Speaker: ock
Dialogue: You wouldn't lie to your Professor now, would you?

Speaker: liz
Dialogue: Of course not. Why would I lie about a thing like that? Really. He's... out.

Speaker: ock
Dialogue: We'll wait. OCK grabs LIZ'S HAIR with his WALDOS.

Speaker: liz
Dialogue: What are you doing... let me go! Please... take those things out of my hair!

Speaker: ock
Dialogue: My Waldos, you mean.

Speaker: liz
Dialogue: Whatever you call them... please...

Speaker: ock
Dialogue: Sit.

Speaker: ock
Dialogue: He's a nice boy. A little nerdy maybe, but nice, wouldn't you say?

Speaker: liz
Dialogue: Oh, I don't know. Maybe. He's very inexperienced.

Speaker: ock
Dialogue: You know, you're a fascinating young lady...

Speaker: liz
Dialogue: Thank you...

Speaker: ock
Dialogue: You're so refreshing. You're so...

Speaker: liz
Dialogue: Shocking...?

Speaker: ock
Dialogue: Oh, I wouldn't say shocking...

Speaker: liz
Dialogue: I would!

Speaker: liz
Dialogue: Peter...!

Speaker: peter
Dialogue: Wait here...

Speaker: peter
Dialogue: Liz?

Speaker: ock
Dialogue: Peter Parker has something I want... And I'm going to have something he wants.

Speaker: ock
Dialogue: Who the hell are you?

Speaker: liz
Dialogue: Spider-Man...

Speaker: ock
Dialogue: That's a lot of crap, clown... I am Spider-Man, not you.  Tell him!

Speaker: ock
Dialogue: Let her go? What an excellent idea. If you do not deliver your friend, Mr. Spider-Man, yes. Yes, of course, I'll let her go.

Speaker: liz
Dialogue: Put me down, you mechanical mutant!

Speaker: liz
Dialogue: You jerk!

Speaker: liz
Dialogue: Tell your friend Peter next time I'll get the taxi myself...

Speaker: ock
Dialogue: Hey... you jerk... you phony Spider-Man... Prepare to meet your death, bug.

Speaker: ock
Dialogue: I am thinking, insect. I'm thinking about exterminating you!

Speaker: liz
Dialogue: Great...

Speaker: ock
Dialogue: Now I must kill you, you cretinous clown.

Speaker: ock
Dialogue: Once I dispose of you, Spider-Man, no one will be able to stop me.

Speaker: ock
Dialogue: My destiny!

Speaker: ock
Dialogue: That's Professor Octopus to you Spider Jerk!

Speaker: liz
Dialogue: What do you think you're doing?

Speaker: liz
Dialogue: Thanks but nooooooooooo!

Speaker: liz
Dialogue: Wait a minute. Where are you taking me? SPIDEY hounded by the Police, rejected by the girl.

Speaker: liz
Dialogue: Where are we?

Speaker: liz
Dialogue: If you're trying to impress me Spidey, I want you to know I'm not easy. Okay, I'm impressed... now put me down, Spidey... put me down.

Speaker: liz
Dialogue: Wow... look, this is our dormitory. I can get to my room. Hey, wait a minute... there's Flash, if I'm not mistaken.

Speaker: liz
Dialogue: You know my name?

Speaker: liz
Dialogue: Okay, put me down and we can talk, alright?

Speaker: liz
Dialogue: All I know is you're the Amazing Spider-Man... or better you're Spidey the good guy on the block... you're a weirdo in a clown spider suit.

Speaker: liz
Dialogue: Which one?

Speaker: liz
Dialogue: Well, Flash is not exactly my boyfriend...

Speaker: liz
Dialogue: There's someone I like, but he's too shy to notice.

Speaker: flash
Dialogue: Liz!  SPIDER-MAN!!!

Speaker: liz
Dialogue: You know everybody... Flash we have to call Peter!

Speaker: flash
Dialogue: Hey, they won't let up, man!  They keep calling you an accomplice in that burglary murder. But that's a crock, ain't it? I'm with you, Spidey, 100%

Speaker: flash
Dialogue: By the way, what are you doing with... Liz?

Speaker: flash
Dialogue: Oh... okay! This calls for a beer! A lot of beer!

Speaker: flash
Dialogue: Well... take care of that later. Wait here. I'll get the beer.

Speaker: liz
Dialogue: How'd you know this was Flash's place?

Speaker: liz
Dialogue: Peter told you all about Flash?

Speaker: flash
Dialogue: Hey, where'd he go? Hey, Spider-Man!!

Speaker: liz
Dialogue: Peter told your Hero all about me...

Speaker: flash
Dialogue: He would, wouldn't he... that jerk!

Speaker: peter
Dialogue: Octavius!!!

Speaker: peter
Dialogue: Kim! Have you seen Harry?

Speaker: kim
Dialogue: Sure, lots of times. What a brainiac...

Speaker: peter
Dialogue: Yeah... have you seen him today?

Speaker: kim
Dialogue: No, un unh.

Speaker: liz
Dialogue: Peter...!

Speaker: peter
Dialogue: Hi... have you seen Harry?

Speaker: liz
Dialogue: No. What a night, huh?

Speaker: peter
Dialogue: Yeah, that was some ride home... must have been pretty exciting.

Speaker: liz
Dialogue: It was... okay. Look, I got two tickets to Les Miserables... wanna go?

Speaker: peter
Dialogue: Sorry... I'm really busy... I mean, not tonight... see you later.

Speaker: liz
Dialogue: Hey, Peter... how did you know about last night...?

Speaker: peter
Dialogue: What about last night?

Speaker: liz
Dialogue: My exciting ride with Spider-Man...

Speaker: peter
Dialogue: Oh... Sorry... I gotta hurry... I have to find Harry... I'll see you later.

Speaker: liz
Dialogue: Peter!

Speaker: peter
Dialogue: Hey! Can I get a lift downtown?

Speaker: flash
Dialogue: Take your shoes for a walk, Dork.

Speaker: ock
Dialogue: We are new inserting Peter Parker's data on tonight's Planetary Conjunction.

Speaker: ock
Dialogue: Yes, yes! Go on! Go on!

Speaker: ock
Dialogue: Enormous. It's enormous.  Adding this to present maximum power potential, I get...

Speaker: ock
Dialogue: I knew it. I knew it! Universal destruction! It's doable! I am putting a countdown clock on the Planetary Conjunction now!

Speaker: ock
Dialogue: Okey, dokey. Now let's see if I have enough power to drive this beast.

Speaker: peter
Dialogue: There you are, I've been looking for you all over town.

Speaker: harry
Dialogue: What happened?

Speaker: peter
Dialogue: Where were you?

Speaker: harry
Dialogue: I went to the wrestling, wanted to see that Amazing Spider-Man, but he didn't show up.

Speaker: peter
Dialogue: Listen, Harry something terrible happened.

Speaker: harry
Dialogue: What? What?

Speaker: peter
Dialogue: My Planetary Conjunction papers... they were stolen...

Speaker: harry
Dialogue: Oh my God... Are you sure...? Who would do such a thing?

Speaker: peter
Dialogue: Ock...

Speaker: harry
Dialogue: Of course... but why...?

Speaker: peter
Dialogue: We have to find out, sit down.  I want to access Dr. Octavius' main program. I want to know about his experiments with the cyclotron. Can you do it?

Speaker: harry
Dialogue: I can try. I could access the system in the dorm. Okay. And through that I could crack the main line.

Speaker: peter
Dialogue: Alright. Now if we can just disrupt the Octavius file...

Speaker: harry
Dialogue: Okay, let's try.

Speaker: peter
Dialogue: Yeah?

Speaker: peter
Dialogue: Mr. Jameson, you got me at a bad time.

Speaker: jameson
Dialogue: What about that kid? On the job already?

Speaker: ock
Dialogue: Fusion cells...? All up. Internal temperature... okay. Risk?  Let's fly.

Speaker: harry
Dialogue: Got something!

Speaker: peter
Dialogue: What is it?

Speaker: harry
Dialogue: Let me see. It's some kind of countdown clock.

Speaker: peter
Dialogue: Countdown to what?

Speaker: harry
Dialogue: I don't know, but whatever it is, it's only six hours away.

Speaker: peter
Dialogue: The Planetary Conjunction?

Speaker: harry
Dialogue: Could be...

Speaker: peter
Dialogue: Or Doc Ock's end of the world experiment... Or both!

Speaker: harry
Dialogue: Wait a minute. You're not telling me you think the world is gonna end tonight...?

Speaker: peter
Dialogue: You want to wait around till midnight to find out?

Speaker: harry
Dialogue: No, but...

Speaker: peter
Dialogue: Let's see what else we've got.

Speaker: harry
Dialogue: What's that?

Speaker: peter
Dialogue: It might be a calculation of the amount of power he needs to create the hole between the force and the anti-force.

Speaker: harry
Dialogue: That's a lot of energy. What could generate power like that?

Speaker: peter
Dialogue: The closest you could come is the New York City Subway System.

Speaker: roz
Dialogue: Plutonium...

Speaker: boy
Dialogue: Make up your mind!

Speaker: girl
Dialogue: What's going on?

Speaker: woman
Dialogue: Oh my God!

Speaker: man
Dialogue: Get back! Get back!

Speaker: woman
Dialogue: Henry!!!

Speaker: woman
Dialogue: What are you doing here? Get out of here! Get out of here!

Speaker: woman
Dialogue: It's Spider-Man!

Speaker: woman
Dialogue: Hey, what are you talking about?!

Speaker: man
Dialogue: Go Spidey! Go!

Speaker: woman
Dialogue: Is that the real Spider-Man?

Speaker: henry
Dialogue: Come on. Come on. That's it. Step lively now.

Speaker: wife
Dialogue: Henry, the rugs!

Speaker: henry
Dialogue: Oh, shut up!

Speaker: fireman
Dialogue: Gimme more ladder! I need more ladder!

Speaker: walkie
Dialogue: Negative on that, you're at full extension!

Speaker: roz
Dialogue: This is Doctor Otto Octavius' work. I must get back to my university. I must stop Ock... he's gone crazy. Can you help me?

Speaker: roz
Dialogue: Spider-Man! Listen to me! If he can do this with the train, if he's come this far, then I can pretty well predict his next step. He'll go to Plutonium SL 270 for the power. He must be stopped... or else he'll destroy our world.

Speaker: roz
Dialogue: Wait Spider-Man. I don't think I can make it... You mustn't waste time saving me... you must save the world! You must go and stop Ock!

Speaker: roz
Dialogue: He is looking for Plutonium SL 270 I'm sure...

Speaker: roz
Dialogue: There's only one place he can get the

Speaker: roz
Dialogue: Toxic... toxic dump... any toxic dump

Speaker: cop
Dialogue: And you're looking at twenty years.

Speaker: cop
Dialogue: What the hell!

Speaker: aunt may
Dialogue: You're as lovely as Peter said you were.

Speaker: liz
Dialogue: Thank you. He really wanted so badly to come see you. He called me up out of the blue.

Speaker: aunt may
Dialogue: Tell me about Peter. What's he been up to? He seems so preoccupied.

Speaker: liz
Dialogue: Oh, you know Peter... he's all caught up in some kind of study he's doing. Things are really crazy at the university now. Things are crazy... everywhere. I guess Peter's just... well, you know... pulled into his shell.

Speaker: aunt may
Dialogue: When Peter was little, he loved to hide. In the closets. Under the sink. He always needed a secret place. But when I'd look for him, he'd always laugh... he wanted to be found.

Speaker: liz
Dialogue: Yeah... well. I don't think he wants me to find him... Well, I'd better be going. My friend Flash is picking me up.

Speaker: aunt may
Dialogue: This Flash... he isn't your boyfriend, is he?

Speaker: liz
Dialogue: No... not really... I think you can guess why...

Speaker: aunt may
Dialogue: Elizabeth...? She turns.

Speaker: aunt may
Dialogue: Finders keepers, losers weepers.

Speaker: liz
Dialogue: What?

Speaker: aunt may
Dialogue: That's what I used to say to Peter when I found him.

Speaker: ock
Dialogue: You!!!

Speaker: ock
Dialogue: You're a doomed bug, Wall Crawler. I've no time to waste on you now.

Speaker: female cop
Dialogue: Alright! Freeze! Up against the wall and spread 'em

Speaker: ock
Dialogue: Alright Spider-Bug... here I've come for you...

Speaker: flash
Dialogue: Spider-man! This is unbelievable...!

Speaker: flash
Dialogue: You got it.

Speaker: flash
Dialogue: I'm the best.

Speaker: flash
Dialogue: Roger, wilco, over and out.

Speaker: flash
Dialogue: Why is he going to New Jersey, and who is it in that shitty red car...

Speaker: liz
Dialogue: Don't you recognize him... it's Ock!

Speaker: flash
Dialogue: What does he want with toxic waste?

Speaker: flash
Dialogue: Sorry... can't do anything about this traffic.

Speaker: ock
Dialogue: Okey, dokey...

Speaker: ock
Dialogue: Insect! I am going to squash you to death... Once I lay my Waldos on your skinny bones...

Speaker: ock
Dialogue: Goodbye, Spider-Man!

Speaker: ock
Dialogue: So you've avoided the nuclear pool, have you, Spider-Man?

Speaker: ock
Dialogue: Pity...!

Speaker: ock
Dialogue: Okay... face to face... Catch this!

Speaker: flash
Dialogue: Don't do it, Professor!

Speaker: ock
Dialogue: I know you... and you, young lady. Both of you are in my physic class, aren't you...? Come... you can help me. I need to get some of these drums to my laboratory... help me... and I'll give you special grades. What'd you say?

Speaker: liz
Dialogue: Leave him alone!!!

Speaker: roz
Dialogue: Leave them alone Otto!

Speaker: ock
Dialogue: But, they won't help me. Everybody is trying to destroy my experiment. And so are you, Rosomorf.

Speaker: roz
Dialogue: Otto... I was wrong. I've gone over your research. It's brilliant, Otto. It's mad, but it's brilliant. You have much work left to do. I want to help you, Otto. For the sake of science, go and do your experiment. Leave... these kids alone and I'll help you.

Speaker: ock
Dialogue: You will? You too?

Speaker: ock
Dialogue: Help me with these drums, I need to get them to my laboratory immediately.

Speaker: roz
Dialogue: Do as he says.

Speaker: ock
Dialogue: Drive, Flash, before I flush your girl right down the toilet!

Speaker: roz
Dialogue: Don't lose your energy screaming. Catch this rope and climb up, come on!

Speaker: roz
Dialogue: I've been through the Octavius data. He has enough power with his Plutonium. Especially if he gets his hands on Parker's data, there he has enough power to do what he wants to do. And we are not going to stop him in time before the Planetary Conjunction occurs tonight...

Speaker: peter
Dialogue: Harry?!

Speaker: harry
Dialogue: Peter, where are you?

Speaker: harry
Dialogue: Your Planetary Conjunction data? It's too late... Ock's got your paper, it's in his computer already.

Speaker: harry
Dialogue: But don't worry... he can never use it without Plutonium.

Speaker: harry
Dialogue: Don't worry... he needs a huge amount of power... thousands of volts of electricity... to get to the Anti-Force.

Speaker: harry
Dialogue: Damn... the Conjunction is due at midnight! What are we going to do?

Speaker: ock
Dialogue: Okey, dokey... have fun, young ones... for the last time.

Speaker: liz
Dialogue: What do we do now?

Speaker: flash
Dialogue: We kiss the world goodbye. If he is right, all there is left to do is...

Speaker: liz
Dialogue: Wait... I think I can release my right hand...

Speaker: harry
Dialogue: How much time is left? Wait... I can find out... my God... 59 minutes!

Speaker: harry
Dialogue: I think I can get some help... I can teach anyone how to work a code in five minutes.

Speaker: kim
Dialogue: Hey, this is easy.

Speaker: flash
Dialogue: Hey, Harry I need help.

Speaker: harry
Dialogue: Coming!

Speaker: kim
Dialogue: I got one! I got one!

Speaker: liz
Dialogue: Harry! Get over here!

Speaker: harry
Dialogue: A goddamn water leak...

Speaker: flash
Dialogue: Hey, look at this. Empire State University. This is our cyclotron, right?

Speaker: harry
Dialogue: What does it say?

Speaker: flash
Dialogue: It says "no information on net."

Speaker: harry
Dialogue: Damn... we can't do it...

Speaker: kim
Dialogue: You mean... we can't stop loony Ock...

Speaker: harry
Dialogue: I mean the world is in danger...

Speaker: flash
Dialogue: We must find Peter, he knows these computers better than all of us.

Speaker: harry
Dialogue: Yes, but where the hell is he?

Speaker: liz
Dialogue: I bet he is with Spider-Man...

Speaker: liz
Dialogue: Look at the moon... I have never seen it so big.

Speaker: flash
Dialogue: What is that...

Speaker: harry
Dialogue: Must be the sun.

Speaker: roz
Dialogue: Our campus... right there... see those beams from Ock's lab. We're late... it's coming... the Conjunction will happen in a few seconds.

Speaker: roz
Dialogue: Where...? What...?

Speaker: ock
Dialogue: Aha! You never included the Conjunction in your calculations, did you?! Rosomorf!

Speaker: roz
Dialogue: Damn the calculations! My God, Otto, you have to hear me! The world we know will collapse! Everything we have devoted our lives to... all the patterns, all the harmonies... everything will be destroyed.

Speaker: ock
Dialogue: A new world waits! Rosomorf! It is my destiny!!!

Speaker: roz
Dialogue: It is cosmic suicide! You have no right!

Speaker: roz
Dialogue: You have to stop him... Spider-Man you have to stop him.

Speaker: liz
Dialogue: He's in there. I know Peter is in there. She breaks into a run.

Speaker: flash
Dialogue: Liz, don't... Liz come back... come back! LIZ runs inside. They run after her. A BOLT OF ELECTRICITY flashes across the doorway, stopping them.

Speaker: ock
Dialogue: Okey, dokey!! My energy storm has started. My Anti-Force is on! History is being made... Spider-Man, Rosomorf cheer up friends... we're on our way to the unknown cosmos... we three are about to visit heaven... real Gods heaven.

Speaker: roz
Dialogue: Spider-Man! The Conjunction! It's happening!

Speaker: liz
Dialogue: Peter! Peter, where are you?!

Speaker: flash
Dialogue: Liz! Liz come on out!

Speaker: harry
Dialogue: Get back! Flash... get back!

Speaker: flash
Dialogue: Wow...!

Speaker: liz
Dialogue: Peter!

Speaker: flash
Dialogue: Oh my God... Liz is inside there!

Speaker: harry
Dialogue: And Professor Rosomorf and crazy Ock.

Speaker: flash
Dialogue: What about Peter? Is he there with them?

Speaker: harry
Dialogue: No, but I bet Spider-Man is.

Speaker: max
Dialogue: That's some show... if ever I saw one.

Speaker: jameson
Dialogue: Tear out the front page! Change the headline... The biggest news is happening right now... we need photos... a camera... get me a camera...!

Speaker: roz
Dialogue: Where is it going Otto?

Speaker: ock
Dialogue: Other worlds, Roz, other times, other dimensions, who knows? Who cares?

Speaker: roz
Dialogue: Then... why?

Speaker: ock
Dialogue: Truth, Rosomorf. Look at it! The new truth! The new way!

Speaker: ock
Dialogue: No, you don't listen to that clown, he can't save you, or the world for that matter.

Speaker: ock
Dialogue: Once and for all, Spider-Man... once and for all we'll end the legend of your powers.

Speaker: ock
Dialogue: You!! You were my teacher!!!

Speaker: ock
Dialogue: You were my teacher! And you want to destroy my experiment. You are a scientist for heaven sake... don't you want to know what's up there?

Speaker: roz
Dialogue: Yes, but not on account of our world. We have only one world... only one life. The floor begins to craze and then crack like ice around a hole on a pond. BANG! BANG! SPIDEY comes to just as the section of floor beneath himself and ROZ gives way and falls through.

Speaker: roz
Dialogue: Spider-Man! Only you can save us now...

Speaker: ock
Dialogue: Forget that old fool, insect. My Spider-Man... Come join me on my fantastic voyage to the 7th heaven.

Speaker: liz
Dialogue: Peter! Peter!

Speaker: liz
Dialogue: Where's Peter? He must be here somewhere.

Speaker: liz
Dialogue: This building is flying. I'm in a goddamn flying building...

Speaker: liz
Dialogue: Oh my God...

Speaker: ock
Dialogue: Spider-Man. You're end is coming. Life in its present form is ending... new dimensions, new horizons...

Speaker: liz
Dialogue: What is happening?

Speaker: liz
Dialogue: I can't... hold on!

Speaker: ock
Dialogue: You cut my power... there's too little power... It's so tiny... so tiny... there's only space... for me. But I've done it, Spider-Man. I have broken through... I've broken through!

Speaker: liz
Dialogue: Don't do it, Dr. Octavius!

Speaker: ock
Dialogue: Okey... dokey... Now that's what I call an experiment!!!

Speaker: liz
Dialogue: But what about Peter? We've got to find Peter!

Speaker: liz
Dialogue: Go where?

Speaker: liz
Dialogue: It's breaking apart!

Speaker: liz
Dialogue: We have to go back.

Speaker: liz
Dialogue: Forget it...

Speaker: liz
Dialogue: What am I supposed to do with this!

Speaker: liz
Dialogue: The door is stuck.

Speaker: peter
Dialogue: Come on. I've found a way down.

Speaker: liz
Dialogue: I knew you were going to say that.

Speaker: liz
Dialogue: Where's the way out?

Speaker: peter
Dialogue: Right there!

Speaker: peter
Dialogue: Come on, help me with this.

Speaker: peter
Dialogue: Okay, stand still.

Speaker: liz
Dialogue: Is this going to work?

Speaker: peter
Dialogue: How do I know?

Speaker: liz
Dialogue: I just adore confidence in a man.

Speaker: peter
Dialogue: Come on...

Speaker: liz
Dialogue: What is it you say when you jump?

Speaker: peter
Dialogue: Your prayers.

Speaker: liz
Dialogue: We have a lot to thank your friend Spider-Man for.

Speaker: peter
Dialogue: Somehow, I don't think we've seen the last of him.

Speaker: liz
Dialogue: Peter...! Finders, keepers...

Speaker: peter
Dialogue: What...? What is it? Why do you look like that?

Speaker: liz
Dialogue: I think I'm in love.

Speaker: peter
Dialogue: You are...

Speaker: liz
Dialogue: With your friend...

Speaker: peter
Dialogue: Spider-Man? You're in love with Spider-Man?

Speaker: liz
Dialogue: I am... you think we'll see him again?

Speaker: peter
Dialogue: We might... you never know. He kisses her.

Speaker: liz
Dialogue: Oh.  This may be the end of a beautiful friendship you know?

Speaker: peter
Dialogue: Nah.
